questions.question_text: A user is trying to setup a security policy for ELB. The user wants ELB to meet the cipher supported by the client by configuring the server order preference in ELB security policy. Which of the below mentioned preconfigured policies supports this feature?

discussion.content: None. Its ELBSecurityPolicy-2016-08

comments.content: I believe the updated answer would be: ELBSecurityPolicy-2016-08
Thanks, awscertifird. Taking my SysOps exam soon!

discussion.content: A. ELBSecurity Policy-2014-01

questions.answer_description:
Elastic Load Balancing uses a Secure Socket Layer (SSL) negotiation configuration which is known as a Security Policy. It is used to negotiate the SSL connections between a client and the load balancer. If the load balancer is configured to support the Server Order Preference, then the load balancer gets to select the first cipher in its list that matches any one of the ciphers in the client's list. When the user verifies the preconfigured policies supported by ELB, the policy
ג€ELBSecurity Policy-2014-01ג€ supports server order preference.

questions.question_text: A user has configured ELB with Auto Scaling. The user suspended the Auto Scaling AlarmNotification which notifies Auto Scaling for CloudWatch alarms. process for a while. What will Auto Scaling do during this period?

choices.B: AWS will receive the alarms but will not execute the Auto Scaling policy
choices.D: It is not possible to suspend the AlarmNotification process
choices.C: Auto Scaling will execute the policy but it will not launch the instances until the process is resumed
choices.A: AWS will not receive the alarms from CloudWatch

questions.answer_description:
Auto Scaling performs various processes, such as Launch, Terminate Alarm Notification etc. The user can also suspend individual process. The AlarmNotification process type accepts notifications from the Amazon CloudWatch alarms that are associated with the Auto Scaling group. If the user suspends this process type,
Auto Scaling will not automatically execute the scaling policies that would be triggered by the alarms.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
When the user suspends the Auto Scaling AlarmNotification process, AWS will continue to receive the alarms from CloudWatch, but it will not automatically execute the Auto Scaling policies associated with those alarms. This means that if the conditions specified in the CloudWatch alarms are met, Auto Scaling will not automatically trigger scaling actions like launching or terminating instances until the process is resumed. This can be useful if the user wants to temporarily prevent Auto Scaling actions from being taken in response to alarm conditions.
Correct Answer: B
B. AWS will receive the alarms but will not execute the Auto Scaling policy

questions.question_text: George has launched three EC2 instances inside the US-East-1a zone with his AWS account. Ray has launched two EC2 instances in the US-East-1a zone with his AWS account. Which of the below mentioned statements will help George and Ray understand the availability zone (AZ) concept better?
questions.answer_description:
Each AWS region has multiple, isolated locations known as Availability Zones. To ensure that the AWS resources are distributed across the Availability Zones for a region, AWS independently maps the Availability Zones to identifiers for each account. In this case the Availability Zone US-East-1a where George's EC2 instances are running might not be the same location as the US-East-1a zone of Ray's EC2 instances. There is no way for the user to coordinate the Availability
Zones between accounts.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
This statement clarifies that while George and Ray are both using the "US-East-1a" identifier, it is important to note that within a region like "us-east-1," availability zones are different and isolated from each other. In this case, even though they are both in "US-East-1a," the availability zones of George and Ray can actually be different physical locations with their own independent infrastructure. This concept emphasizes the importance of using multiple availability zones for higher availability and fault tolerance.

I am not sure of D US-East-1 is the region and us-East-1a is the availability zone

For George 
AZ US-East-1a Location 1 
AZ US-East-1b Location 2
AZ US-East-1c Location 3 
For Ray
AZ US-East-1a Location 4 
AZ US-East-1b Location 5
AZ US-East-1c Location 6 
So The ec2 instances may have different locations but they will be in same AZ us-east-1a. 
The above makes A and D wrong. B is also wrong

We know that the data-transfer within the same region is no-cost so 
The correct answer would be C
Correct Answer: D

the Availability Zone us-east-1a for your AWS account might not be the same location as us-east-1a for another AWS account. To coordinate Availability Zones across accounts, you must use the AZ ID, which is a unique and consistent identifier for an Availability Zone.

Above info from AZ section in https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AWSEC2/latest/UserGuide/using-regions-availability-zones.html
So answer is D
Ans A: "US-East-1a" is one of the N.Virginia AZs which means is the same data center

comments.content: No ...D is correct...Good explanation by Golddust...

discussion.content:
Could be B. 
Because that is no US-East-1a region

comments.content:
US-East-1a refers to the account's Availability zone. AWS assign different availability zones per account.

Therefore my AZ 1 and your AZ1 in not guaranteed to be the same data center. 

They mainly do this to spread customers over various data centers. It is human nature than everyone will choose AZ1 and therefore they are not the same.

discussion.content: D. The US-East-1a region of George and Ray can be different availability zones

choices.D: The US-East-1a region of George and Ray can be different availability zones
choices.C: All the instances of George and Ray can communicate over a private IP without any cost
choices.B: All the instances of George and Ray can communicate over a private IP with a minimal cost
choices.A: The instances of George and Ray will be running in the same data center

questions.question_text:
A user had aggregated the CloudWatch metric data on the AMI ID. The user observed some abnormal behavior of the CPU utilization metric while viewing the last
2 weeks of data. The user wants to share that data with his manager. How can the user achieve this easily with the AWS console?
questions.answer_description: Amazon CloudWatch provides the functionality to graph the metric data generated either by the AWS services or the custom metric to make it easier for the user to analyze. The console provides the option to save the URL or bookmark it so that it can be used in the future by typing the same URL. The Copy URL functionality is available under the console when the user selects any metric to view.

choices.C: The user has to find the period and data and provide all the aggregation information to the manager
choices.A: The user can use the copy URL functionality of CloudWatch to share the exact details
choices.B: The user can use the export data option from the CloudWatch console to export the current data point
choices.D: The user can use the CloudWatch data copy functionality to copy the current data points

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
You can share your CloudWatch dashboards with people who do not have direct access to your AWS account. This enables you to share dashboards across teams, with stakeholders, and with people external to your organization. You can even display dashboards on big screens in team areas, or embed them in Wikis and other webpages.

Selected Answer: A
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/monitoring/cloudwatch-dashboard-sharing.html
Correct Answer: A
A. The user can use the copy URL functionality of CloudWatch to share the exact details

questions.question_text: A user has setup a CloudWatch alarm on the EC2 instance for CPU utilization. The user has setup to receive a notification on email when the CPU utilization is higher than 60%. The user is running a virus scan on the same instance at a particular time. The user wants to avoid receiving an email at this time. What should the user do?

choices.C: Modify the CPU utilization by removing the email alert
choices.B: Disable the alarm for a while using CLI
choices.D: Disable the alarm for a while using the console

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
alarms in CloudWatch can be disabled using the AWS CLI, but not directly from the AWS Management Console.

Selected Answer: B
https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/monitoring/AlarmThatSendsEmail.html

Selected Answer: B
It seems alarms can be disable only with the CLI (https://docs.aws.amazon.com/cli/latest/reference/cloudwatch/disable-alarm-actions.html#:~:text=disable%2Dalarm%2Dactions-,Description,when%20the%20alarm%20state%20changes.&text=See%20'aws%20help'%20for%20descriptions%20of%20global%20parameters.)
I'm going with B.
Correct Answer: B
B. Disable the alarm for a while using CLI
